intro: Palaquium kinabaluense, commonly known as the Kinabalu palaquium, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at elevations above 1,000 meters. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain a single seed, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
